item.description:
Join me for a much needed break in the week!

Blackstone Gorge is a U-shaped Rolling Dam with water cascading lightly into the ongoing river. Come walk some of the well-worn paths, or off-path, parallel to the river, towards the higher rock elevations culminating at 100 feet, at some points, which are known as the Gorge.

Rocky paths with some elevation. Hiking boots or good sneakers suggested. Bring water! I will have bug spray.

Directions: From Route 122 look for a small sign for "Blackstone Gorge Tour Boat Parking." Turn here onto Carrington Street and go two blocks. Turn right onto County Street and go 0.1 miles to the parking lot for Blackstone Gorge on the left, marked by a white Blackstone Gorge DCR sign and a purple Blackstone Gorge (Heritage Corridor) sign.

We will wait 10 minutes. Please call if your going to be late. 508-415-0590
If you can only make B&B Grumpy's is located at 190 Pulaski Blvd (Route 126) in Bellingham.

After we'll head to Grumpy's, just 5 minutes away for a beer and burger.
item.name: Mid-Week Mini Hike and Beer & Burger
